creator: dan.luther@wcg.com

text:
After further digging, it appears you left off the "chartables.c" file from the 
distribution. 

tsk tsk...
creator: dan.luther@wcg.com
trawick@apache.org
text:
chartables.c is a generated file.  It is generated by dftables.  Is dftables 
getting built in your srclib/pcre directory?  If you change to srclib/pcre and 
run "make chartables.c", what happens?

creator: dan.luther@wcg.com
text:
Thanks for the reply, Jeff. 

Using 'make chartables.c' yields a "make: Nothing to be done for 
`chartables.c'." error. 

However, looking at what you said, there may be a different problem altogether. 
I know of at least one other person who had this same error. I ended up solving 
it by downloading the 'pcre' package from SourceForge and copying the 
chartables.c file into this directory and continuing the make.

I also just deleted the chartables.c file, ran 'make' and it completed 
successfully.
